listing.listing_description:
Steps from the bustling streets of La Jolla, find seclusion, and an ocean view on the rooftop patio of this beach community home. When you’re not gazing out towards the Pacific from the alfresco bar, sit back and sip cocktails by the fire pit. Later, move the party inside to the games room and start a foosball tournament. If you’re up for a 10-minute stroll, check out the bars in La Jolla.

The straight, yet unique, lines of contemporary architecture bring Sunny Shores to life, creating an exciting atmosphere for a family vacation or getaway with friends. Start your morning with a coffee under the shade of an umbrella or overhang on the terrace. Once everyone is up, gather in the fully-equipped kitchen’s bar to discuss sightseeing plans over breakfast. If you’re not quite ready to leave, stream a few episodes on the widescreen in the games room or have a relaxing soak in the master ensuite’s deep tub.

Fourteen miles from downtown San Diego, the town of La Jolla is well decorated with sandy beachfront, the nearest being Windansea. After the 10-minute walk to the beach, throw down a towel, and work on your vacation tan. If you’re feeling adventurous, sign up for a surfing lesson. For calmer waters, visit La Jolla Cove. If you’re traveling with the kids, San Diego Zoo makes for an unforgettable afternoon excursion. At night, watch the sunset from atop the rollercoaster at Belmont Park.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Ski-in, ski-out access, luxury amenities and cozy interiors will have you falling for Skyfall Ridge 702. Part of the Edgemont community in Steamboat Springs, this refined Colorado vacation rental is just steps from both the Stampede ski run at Steamboat Ski Resort and exclusive community features. Book the two-bedroom villa for a quiet parents-and-kids ski break or a honeymoon in the mountains.

Your holiday at Skyfall Ridge 702 includes access to the shared heated outdoor pool, hot tub and ski storage at Edgemont, as well as a complimentary seasonal shuttle. After a day on the slopes, bring the kids to the outdoor firepit for s’mores and hot chocolate, or unwind by the fireplace in the communal lounge. For private evenings in, the villa has its own balcony with a barbecue and mountain views and, inside, a wine cooler, fireplace and flat-screen television that will tempt you to curl up and relax.

The villa’s interiors put a modern twist on traditional mountain lodge style. The open-plan great room boasts vaulted, beamed ceilings, plenty of windows with panoramic views and soft, neutral tones for a quietly stylish vibe. The sitting and dining areas share the double-sided fireplace, so you can listen to the flames crackle from the large sectional or the nailhead-trimmed dining chairs. A breakfast bar and office nook mean that other guests can keep the cook company in the fully equipped gourmet kitchen.

Even the bedrooms at Skyfall Ridge 702 have mountain views. The master suite is well appointed with a king bed, en-suite bathroom, fireplace and its own door to the balcony. If you’re traveling as a family or as a groupe of friends, the second bedroom is well equipped with a double size bunk bed, balcony access and a hall bathroom.

One of the biggest perks of staying at Edgemont is the ski-in, ski-out access to the Stampede run via the ground floor of the complex. The community is also conveniently close to the shopping and dining in the mountain village. During the warmer months, use the villa as a base for rounds of golf at the nearby Rollingstone Ranch course or rafting, kayaking and fishing expeditions on the Yampa River. No matter what time of year you visit, you’ll always find naturally heated mineral waters and a laid-back ambience at the Old Town and Strawberry Park hot springs, just a short drive from the property.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
The namesake slope rises above the terrace at this traditional-on-the-outside, contemporary-on-the-inside Beverly Hills retreat. Its palm-lined drive and red-tiled roof speak to classic California style, while a massive stone fireplace makes a statement in the great room. While a cul-de-sac setting makes for a quiet stay, it’s less than 10 miles to Rodeo Drive, Universal Studios, and more.

 Mature landscaping makes the sunny terrace and curving pool feel like a private hideaway. There’s also a barbecue and a shaded al-fresco dining area for serving whatever you’ve grilled up. Finish the evening with a soak in the outdoor hot tub, a drink from the indoor wet bar, a favorite show on the smart TV, or a scroll through all your feeds via Wi-Fi.

 The mass of the double-sided stone fireplace echoes that of the mountain, bringing the landscape indoors to separate the two living rooms. A round dining table has seating for eight friends or family members, and there’s also a breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen along with stainless steel appliances.

 This luxury property has one master bedroom with a king bed, en-suite bathroom, and honeymoon-suite-worthy details such as a jetted tub and its own lounge area. There are also three bedrooms with queen beds: two that share a bathroom, and one that shares access to a hall bathroom.

 While the villa feels tucked away, a holiday at this vacation rental puts you within easy reach of some of L.A.’s most iconic attractions, whether the boutiques of Rodeo Drive or the world-class collection of the Getty Center. Catch a concert at the Hollywood Bowl or, if you’re traveling with the kids, treat them to a day at Universal Studios. With three beaches within 25 miles, you can take a day trip to play in the sand or try out surfing.

 Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
The decorative cattle skull is the only Old-West touch in this clean-lined model of New West living just outside downtown Austin. Palm trees around the pool terrace (and palm-print wallpaper) lend a resort feel, while the restaurant-grade range will make you feel like a pro chef. Bring your bathing suit on the 2-minute drive to Zilker Park, whose 358 acres include the 3-acre Barton Springs Pool.

 Spend sunny days outside on the private backyard deck, which features a row of loungers, alfresco dining for 6, and a barbecue, and which is edged by a lap pool. After a day out in the city’s galleries or on the golf course, cozy up to the wood-burning fireplace, switch on the cable TV, face off against friends and family across the ping-pong table, or check in from your holiday via Wi-Fi.

 A glass wall and vaulted ceiling bring light and air into the white-walled living room, where a sofa and lounge chairs sit atop a natural-fiber area rug. There’s banquette seating around a mod Tulip table in an adjacent breakfast nook, as well as a breakfast bar fronting the professional-grade range in the fully equipped kitchen.

 This vacation rental has 2 bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms: a master suite with a king bed and terrace, and a second bedroom with 2 twin beds. There’s also 1 bedroom with a queen bed and 2 bedrooms with 2 queen beds each, all 3 of which have shared hall-bathroom access.

 A stay at the villa gives you the luxury of a quiet setting along with easy access to the city’s hot spots. Take a honeymoon from the everyday in Zilker Park, capped off with a swim in spring-fed Barton Springs Pool. Or take a free tour of the Texas Capitol building, just under 5 miles away, followed by a concert or cocktail at one of the venues, bars, and restaurants downtown.

 Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Relax in a quintessential Napa and Sonoma estate at Knights Valley Vista. This spectacular vacation rental has it all: dramatic views of the landscape and vineyards, luxury amenities, magazine-worthy style and a charmingly rural location just outside the town of Calistoga. Plan your California wine country escape with a group of up to eight friends or family members.

Knights Valley Vista sits on more than 200 private acres overlooking Mt. St. Helena, lined with seven miles of hiking paths that meander through vineyards of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Chardonnay. The grounds also feature a swimming pool, hot tub, bocce court, lounging and dining areas, a barbecue and a firepit. For your evening entertainment, there’s a satellite TV, Sonos sound system and Wi-Fi.

Designed for indoor-outdoor living that takes full advantage of the gorgeous setting, the villa is laid out around an expansive open-concept great room. Here, stone walls frame the living area, dining area, and fully equipped kitchen, and several sets of doors lead to the outdoor areas. A recent renovation added luxe finishes such as marble countertops and intricate tilework.

The main house at Knights Valley Vista has a honeymoon-worthy master bedroom with a king bed, en-suite bedroom, fireplace and private access to the terrace with the hot tub. The other two bedrooms are in a guest house; one has a king bed and en-suite bathroom, and the other has a queen bed and shared access to a hall bathroom. For larger parties, an office in the main house has a queen Murphy bed.

While you could easily spend your holiday simply exploring the villa’s grounds, it’s well worth taking a drive to nearby towns. Knights Valley Vista is less than a 5-mile drive from Calistoga, and less than a 20-mile drive from both Oakville and Santa Rosa. Leave time to stop off at the wineries you pass along the way—or to simply pause and take in the views.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
World-class golf and shopping, unforgettable performances at the Coachella festival or on the Empire Polo Grounds, the otherworldly scenery of Joshua Tree National Park: they’re all at the doorstep of Mirador. Whether you’re coming to Indio for a special occasion, an event or just a little California sunshine, this luxury vacation rental is a private oasis in the Desert Cities.

Spend the day on the fairways or festival grounds, then return to cool off in the pool or have a nap on one of the loungers on the terrace. Heat up the barbecue and serve dinner at the outdoor table, then watch the stars come out from around the firepit or in the private hot tub. If you’d prefer to unwind or entertain indoors, there’s a games room with vintage and modern options, a surround sound system and Wi-Fi.

From its charming Mediterranean-style facade to its inviting contemporary interiors, Mirador packs a serious style punch. The heart of the villa is an open-plan great room with a sitting area, dining area and a fully equipped kitchen. Details such as a geometric rug, shag-topped footstools, a globe chandelier and a wall of white subway tile give the space a fresh yet welcoming feel.

The villa’s five bedrooms—four in the main house and one in a casita—can accommodate up to ten friends or extended family on holiday together. In the main house, you’ll find two bedrooms with king beds and en-suite bathrooms, and two bedrooms with a queen and two double beds, respectively, with hall bathrooms. With its king bed, en-suite bathroom and direct terrace access, the casita could double as a honeymoon-style retreat.

Mirador is a 10-minute drive or less from three golf courses, the Coachella festival grounds, and shopping and dining in both downtown Indio and Old Town La Quinta. Drive a bit farther and you’ll come to the Indian Wells Tennis Garden, home to the BNP Paribas Open, and several more golf courses. For a memorable day trip, explore the mid-century architecture of Palm Springs or the totally natural (and often stark) scenery of Joshua Tree National Park.

City ID # 19-00021223

listing.listing_description:
Just a short stroll from beautiful downtown Ketchum and the Sun Valley Resort, this private four bedroom has the perfect location for a secluded family getaway while enjoying quick and easy access to shopping, dining, nightlife, and skiing. Within an eight-minute drive, you’ll have access to world-class skiing at Sun Valley Lodge, Bald Mountain, and Dollar Mountain. If you’re traveling in the warmer month, Elkhorn Golf Club is just nine minutes from home. And, there’s plenty more to discover in Sun Valley, no matter what time of the year you’re vacationing.

This sleek and stylish villa puts a modern spin on the traditional ski lodge with its clean straight lines, open concept floor plan, and bright, elegant white interior color scheme. The living room is adorned with state of the electronics, designer furnishings, and gorgeous stone mantle with a wood burning fireplace. The vaulted ceiling is extra-high, and the walls underneath are made up of forest view framing glass, setting a warm and inviting tone in the living room that you and your guests will love.

Bitterroot is the perfect host for family dinner, with formal and alfresco dining for eight, a fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar, dishwasher, and barbecue. After your meal, curl up with a good book by the fireplace or settle in for a family movie night in the media room. If you’ve still got some energy to burn, head over to the Sun Valley Lodge, where you’ll have complimentary use of their swimming pool, jacuzzi, and sauna.

After you’ve spent some time on the slopes or at one of the nearby golf clubs, reward yourself with a night on the town. Downtown Ketchum, just a four-minute walk from home, has a wide range of dining options, from fine French, Italian, and American restaurants to casual pubs. If you feel like catching one of the latest movies, Magic Lantern Cinemas is delightful old-old-style theatre, great for family outings. And, if you’d like to explore even more of Idaho’s breathtaking environment, Sawtooth National Forest is a great afternoon excursion.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Flowing water joins the birds and wind on the soundtrack to this mid-century bungalow 5 miles north of downtown Austin. Mature oak trees shade the yard and frame vistas over the hills, and while the villa itself is 60 years old, it’s been refreshed with an open-concept layout. Hike Mount Bonnell, 2 miles away, for even more panoramic views, or drive into Austin proper for barbecue, bars, and more.

Listen to the breeze ruffle the leaves from a swimming pool with a water feature, a row of loungers on the sunny and private back deck, and shaded alfresco sitting and dining areas with a barbecue, firepit, and outdoor TV. After a day out in the city, start a sing-along around the grand piano, cozy up to the wood-burning fireplace, sip a glass from the wine fridge while watching the streaming TV, and catch up with your feeds over Wi-Fi.

At the heart of this vacation rental is an L-shaped great room whose open-concept family room, dining area, and fully equipped kitchen feel decidedly 21st century. The furnishings, however, nod to the mid-century roots, with a walnut sideboard and Wishbone-inspired bar stools. A separate formal living room has the piano and a temptingly deep blue sofa.

This luxury property has 1 master bedroom with a king bed, ensuite bathroom, and balcony. There are 2 bedrooms with queen beds that share access to a hall bathroom, and 1 bedroom with a king bed and hall bathroom that also has its own entrance.

Spend your holiday hiking Mount Bonnell, swimming in the 3-acre Barton Springs Pool, and strolling alongside locals through Zilker Metropolitan Park, all less than 10 miles away. Drive downtown for a free tour of the Texas State Capitol building and stay there for a night out, or sit down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner on a lantern-lit deck over the waters of Lake Austin.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Enjoy the majestic Rockies and the classic Breckenridge ambience in a brand-new way at Three Sisters Lookout. Perched on Baldy Mountain, this recently built luxury villa is a private retreat that looks down on the town and across to the slopes of the Ten Mile Range—a stunning vista any time of year. Four bedrooms and cozy modern lodge-inspired interiors make this Colorado vacation rental a spacious setting for a family holiday or the perfect backdrop for a secluded, away-from-it-all honeymoon.

Start each day by catching the free public shuttle, located only two blocks away, that brings you to the ski lifts. After a day on the slopes, leave your gear in the villa’s mud room and take a soak in the hot tub or have a drink from the wet bar by the fireplace. In warmer weather, you can prep dinner on the barbecue and enjoy it at the dining area on the deck overlooking the mountains.

Three Sisters Lookout represents classic mountain style rendered in luxurious modern finishes and sprawling layouts worthy of the Western setting. Cathedral ceilings and a two-story stone fireplace soar in the open-plan great room, where leather sofas and dining chairs add rich tones and soft texture. A second sitting area has its own stone fireplace and leather sofa in a more intimate space. Not only does the fully equipped kitchen have a breakfast bar and state-of-the-art appliances, it features a double oven to make light work of meals.

For accommodations, the villa has everything from hotel-worthy suite-style bedrooms to kid-friendly bunk rooms. There are two bedrooms with king beds and en-suite bathrooms, including the master suite, which also has a jetted tub. Another bedroom has a queen bed and access to a shared bathroom. For kids, there’s a bedroom with a twin bunk bed and an en-suite bathroom, a space with two twin beds and a shared bathroom or a cozy nook where they can nestle up in two built-in twin beds.

The fastest way to the slopes from Three Sisters Lookout is to make the 2-minute walk to the public shuttle stop or drive the 4 miles to the lifts. If you have some time in the area, you can also make the 21-mile drive to fresh trails at Copper Mountain. In the evenings, head to downtown Breckenridge, 3.5 miles away, for restaurants and shopping, or take the family skating at the town’s ice arena, about 3 miles away. Book your tickets into Eagle County Regional Airport, 74 miles from the villa, or Denver International Airport, 107 miles away.

Copyright © 2016 Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
The pinnacle of family accommodation in the locality, this huge home is a great option for those seeking a premium stay with quick access to Disney World. This grand home offers diverse, top-level entertainment, themed kids rooms, an Olympic-sized, enclosed pool and 10 bedrooms. Sweep out of the driveway to nearby entertainment parks, fine dining and Orlando in just minutes.

Awakening in the sumptuous, climate-controlled bedrooms of Muirfield London, guests can relax as the kids amuse themselves in the playfully-decorated bedrooms and extensive game rooms. Experience a pleasant dip in the huge pool no matter the weather, with the impressive glass screen ideal for taking in the Florida sun and swaying treetops. Adult guests can let their hair down just as much as the kids at this villa, with the delights of the wet bar being on hand, as well as a huge range of group games including pool, shuffleboard, air hockey and foosball. Outdoor dining is simple via the alfresco table, with the home’s barbecue facilitating group dining on sultry evenings. 

The possibilities for day trips are endless from Muirfield London. Two of the country’s most fabled theme parks, Disney World and Universal Studios, are just minutes by car, while nearby spas, and a massive range of restaurants are similarly close by. Guests can take the family to wildlife refuges, or venture into downtown Orlando for high-end shopping, comedy shows and acclaimed art galleries.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
This luxury vacation home has been featured as "A Dream Vacation Home" in Travel & Leisure Magazine, on NBC's #1 rated news magazine television show Extra!, as an "Ultimate Destination" on NBC's Mansions and Millionaires, on CNN and in Palm Springs Life Magazine.

Experience the peace and tranquility of your own oasis retreat, set against the majestic backdrop of rugged mountains and verdant fairways. Contemporary Dream is an elegant, mid-century Palm Springs villa, whose tasteful design creates a seamless indoor to outdoor living experience. The beautiful, three-bedroom home has caught the eye of the world’s lifestyle media, who consider it the ultimate spot for an unforgettable getaway.

From the private pool terrace, you’ll understand why people have flocked to Palm Springs for over 100 years. Recline on a comfortable chaise longue and bask in the California sun, as you stare up to the San Jacinto Mountains. Canvas parasols shelter a charming al fresco table, where you and your guests can enjoy fresh ingredients grilled on the barbecue. In the evening, ease into the hot tub with a glass of champagne and relax under the stars.

18 ft ceilings, retractable glass walls and clerestory windows provide spectacular views and allow light to stream inside. The villa was designed by a protégé of Frank Lloyd Wright, and features tasteful, modern-contemporary elements. Sandstone floors and earthy hues blend with décor and furniture selected by renowned designer Michael Kreiss, to complete the oasis ambiance. Behind the unique, glass-top dining table, you’ll find a wet bar where you can mix drinks on smooth, granite surfaces. Lovely cabinets and high-end appliances make cooking in the gourmet kitchen a pleasure, and a cozy breakfast table sits adjacent.

Contemporary Dream’s three designer bedrooms are all air conditioned and feature original furnishings, soft bed linens, plasma television and direct access to the outdoors. Each houses a luxuriously-appointed en-suite bathroom. The Master bedroom is spacious, with a King size bed. Its en-suite includes a spa-shower and bathtub. The second bedroom also has a King size bed, while the remaining room is a Queen suite.

The villa places you in an ideal spot for exploring the beauty of your desert surroundings. Indian Canyons is home to great hiking trails, while a drive to Joshua Tree National Park is a worthwhile day trip. You’re adjacent to Indian Canyons Golf Resort, while dozens of additional courses can be found in the vicinity. The upscale shops, restaurants and nightlife of Palm Canyon Drive are just two miles away.

listing.listing_description:
Located just outside of downtown Phoenix, this private nine bedroom is the perfect home base for a luxurious golf trip with friends, family vacation, or high-end corporate retreat. Valley Vista accommodates up to eighteen guests, and its open concept interior and spacious outdoor areas make it easy for everyone to find their own space, as well as gather together as a group. Nearby, you’ll find Arizona’s most vibrant cities, Scottsdale and Phoenix; both are under ten miles from home. And, if you’re in town to golf, there are numerous courses in the area, many within a ten-minute drive of Valley Vista.

Spanish colonial architecture, state of the art electronics, and plush designer furniture combine to create the perfect environment for exciting group gatherings at Valley Vista. With a Smart TV, stereo, Wi-Fi, pool table, and wet bar, you’ll love spending evenings in, creating new memories with old friends.

Valley Vista’s terrace and courtyard are decorated with lush desert greenery, beautiful stone columns that support refreshing shaded areas, and elegant water features. You’ll love cooling off in the swimming pool after a long day on the golf course, and at night when it cools down, the hot tub will help you rejuvenate for another day. At dinner, you’ll have the choice between the formal dining area inside or the alfresco set on the terrace; both have great social atmospheres.

When it’s time to get out and hit the links, you won’t have to travel far with Paradise Valley, Camelback, Orange Tree, and Talking Sticks golf clubs all within ten miles. Travel a little further, and you’ll find Troon North Golf Club and TPC Scottsdale, two of the best courses in the Scottsdale area. There’s plenty to discover in Phoenix, and a great place to start is Roosevelt Row, an easily walkable stretch of exciting new restaurants, markets, and bars. If you’re in the mood to shop, the Biltmore Fashion Park is home to the World’s best brands and restaurants, and it’s just a few minutes from home.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
This incredible slope side chalet allows you to experience everything Breckenridge has to offer – year round. Set at the base of Peak 8, this private condominium is just steps from the gondola that takes you to the ski slopes or right into town. Come experience the great outdoors in Colorado in an environment filled with almost unlimited options suitable for guests of all ages. Whether for a holiday or a honeymoon, book your stay at One Ski Hill 8413!

During your stay at this vacation rental, you can spend time in the lobby with a large, three-sided fireplace or relax in the grand piano living room. The outdoor plaza seats up to 300 guests with a heated deck and fireplace. The aquatics center features an adult pool, children’s pool, indoor and outdoor hot tubs, sauna and steam room. Why not let the children bowl a few games at the two-lane alley while you visit the Rejuvenation Center for a soothing massage? One Ski Hill also features an exercise room, two movie lounges and a games room.

This spacious condo has been beautifully appointed with distinctive, modern finishes. The kitchen features stainless steel Bosch appliances, a wine fridge and granite counter tops. Enjoy a meal in the formal dining area or a snack at the breakfast bar. Entertaining your group is easy in the living area where guests can warm up by the fireplace, read a book or watch television.

The three comfortable bedrooms accommodate up to seven guests at this non-smoking villa. The master suite offers a king bed, gas fireplace, sitting area and flat screen television. The second bedroom has a queen bed as well as a sitting area and flat screen television. Ideal for the children, the third bedroom has a captain’s bunk, a flat screen television and an Xbox 360 game system.

While winters bring some of the best skiing opportunities to Breckenridge, summer activities at the Peak 8 Fun Park include the Gold Runner Coaster, the Alpine SuperSlide, miniature golf, bungee trampolines and a rock climbing wall. Your reservation also includes a free shuttle that will take you and your family anywhere in town for dining, shopping and nightlife. You’ll also find the Breckenridge Golf Club just a few minutes away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
A burbling creek, swaying aspens and the silent, stately Gros Ventre mountain range are your neighbors at the private Fish Creek Lodge 2. Newly built in a peaceful setting outside Teton Village, this Jackson Hole vacation rental is a year-round retreat that’s perfect for family trips to Grand Teton National Park in the summer or ski holidays with friends in the winter. But despite the wild surroundings, three suite-style bedrooms, beautiful finishes and state-of-the-art touches provide plenty of luxury.

The stone-and-timber lodge is a cozy sanctuary in the shadow of the Tetons, with a welcoming fireplace, a separate media room for curling up in front of a favorite movie and, of course, Wi-Fi, so you’re never far from friends. In warmer weather, heat up the barbecue, gather at the outdoor dining area on the stone terrace and watch the stars come out from the Adirondack chairs or the hot tub. Kids will love toasting marshmallows in the outdoor fireplace.

Rough-cut timber, barn doors and a stone fireplace surround play off soft upholstery, graphic area rugs and playful floor lamps for a mountain lodge look with a modern twist. The great room at Fish Creek Lodge 2 soars thirty feet high and is flooded with light—and views—from the floor-to-ceiling window. No matter what the weather in Wyoming, you’ll be comfortable in a leather armchair by the fire or a refined nailhead-trim seat around the dining table. Even the fully equipped kitchen pairs the rustic with the state of the art, blending weathered wood panels and barn lights with a quilted-steel backsplash and Wolf range.

Each of the lodge’s three bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom; two have king beds worthy of a honeymoon suite, and the third has two bunk beds. There’s also a king sofa bed in the media room for larger parties. Like the main living areas, the bedrooms mix the traditional and contemporary, with touches like stone fireplaces, wood floors and wool blankets to provide pops of color.

Though the villa’s setting feels secluded, it’s not isolated. In the summer, ride the nearby Jackson Hole bike path into downtown Jackson or all the way to Grand Teton National Park; in the winter, there’s a complimentary ski shuttle to transport you to the base of Jackson Hole Mountain Resort. For an entirely different mode of transportation, try a paragliding session from a nearby hillside into the meadows near the villa. Test your skill on the landscapes of the two nearby golf courses, soak in a natural pool at Granite Hot Springs or visit the relatively untamed nature of Yellowstone National Park. When it’s time to leave, plan on a 14-mile drive from the lodge to Jackson Hole Airport.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
La Jolla Scenic Retreat is a beautiful luxury villa near the town of La Jolla, near San Diego. Featuring a tennis court, swimming pool, and lovely indoor and outdoor areas, the four-bedroom villa is an ideal private sanctuary for families and friends, while its excellent location puts you within minutes of beaches, Sea World, and Torrey Pines.

Surrounded by lush gardens, the villa's exterior is the perfect setting for relaxation and leisure. Savor long days taking dips in the salt-water swimming pool, immersing yourself in the delicious hot tub, and bathing on sun loungers. Play tennis on the private, newly resurfaced court, while the kids enjoy the Children's Play House. In the late afternoon, enjoy drinks in the outdoor lounge while you fire up the grill for some delicious barbeque, then savor it together at the alfresco dining table on the lanai veranda.

Large, glass-windowed doors open from the porch into the villa's cool interior. The sumptuous lounge is perfect for after-dinner cocktails in the delicious breeze, while the circular dining table under the gorgeous chandelier invites you to memorable feasts. The luminous and fully equipped kitchen has everything you need for preparing meals, while the lovely sunroom is ideal for breakfasts in the morning light. The villa also includes a well-stocked media room, with a large TV and comfy furniture—perfect for cuddling up with your favorite movies.

There are four beautiful bedrooms, along with a queen pullout bed in the family room, allowing the villa to accommodate ten people—ideal for destination wedding guests. The master bedroom features a king bed, elegant armchairs, private access to the pool terrace, and an ensuite bathroom with stand-alone rain shower. The other three bedrooms have queen beds.

La Jolla Scenic Retreat gives you excellent access to greater San Diego. Windansea Beach, La Jolla Cove, and La Jolla Shores Beach are all within two or three miles of your door, with Black's Beach and Torrey Pines State Beach are also just minutes away. Golfers will reach the famous courses of Torrey Pines within minutes, and families will enjoy SeaWorld and the San Diego Zoo, both a short drive away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Backed by the beautiful San Sophia Ridgeline in Mountain Village, Petra Domus is a breathtaking alpine chalet whose majestic beauty is mirrored only by its incredible surroundings. During your stay at this private vacation rental, you will be located just a mile from the Intercept Gondola. Once a remote mining area, today Telluride has become a favorite holiday destination for artists, skiers and celebrities. The freedom of luxuriant powder days and the bonhomie of its famed festivals make Telluride a great bet – any season!

French doors off the great room lead to the large outdoor deck. Under a protective eve, an outdoor sofa, chairs and coffee table create an outdoor living space around a beautiful stone fireplace. Further out on the deck is a dining table for up to six and a gas grill. An outdoor hot tub awaits to help you melt those cares away. Inside, the wet bar may soon become the favorite haunt of the consummate entertainer. Other perks include Wi-Fi and a foosball table.

Upon entering the stone house, guests are welcomed by hardwood floors along with exquisite furnishings and finishes. The spacious great room features vaulted ceilings and plenty living space. Two comfortable sofas and armchairs surround a massive stone fireplace and a hidden flat screen television. A breakfast nook is positioned in the corner of the room with a leather bench and two chairs. A lovely dining table for eight sits adjacent to the gourmet kitchen with granite countertops and Viking stainless steel appliances.

Four exquisite bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms accommodate up to ten guests at this non-smoking villa. Three suites are located in the main house, and the fourth is in a separate guest house with a kitchenette. The master suite includes a king bed, steam shower and fireplace. The bunk suite doubles as an entertainment room for the children.

Whether it’s for a golf retreat or a ski vacation, your entire family is sure to fall in love with this luxury home. You will be a jaunt from both the Mountain Village Core and the Telluride Golf Course. Or for a trip into the past and a look at how mining used to be, be sure to check out the Alta Lakes Ghost Town tour. Great for a wedding or any special event, enjoy the quintessential alpine experience at Petra Domus!

listing.listing_description:
Look out over tropical palms from your oversized rooftop balcony while the kids enjoy the fun and games in the backyard below. Located in Reunion Resort, this 5,000 square foot villa is open, spacious, and offers plenty of outdoor space. Abstract patterns, textured accents, and pops of aqua can be found throughout the property. Glass and chrome décor lend a modern aesthetic. Pack your swimsuit and explore the neighboring water park. 

Under the glow of the morning light, the conservation area is a serene spot to sip a freshly brewed cup of coffee. On the main floor, a games room with neon back-lights hosts a variety of popular multi-arcade games (including Mario Bros, an all-time favourite). Soak up the scorching Florida sun before plunging into the turquoise swimming pool. Dense foliage and a wooden fence surrounding the backyard ensure maximum privacy. As the sun sets, why not soak in the spillover hot tub? The fire pit sparks good conversation and much needed relaxation. 

Ideal for family getaways, the fun and entertainment possibilities are endless—a pool table that converts to a card table, a wet bar, foosball table, and an air hockey table can be found on the 2nd floor. If that’s not enough, Walt Disney World Resort, Universal Studios, and SeaWorld are just a short drive away. Host a movie night in the home theatre which features reclining seats and—calling all Star Wars fans—a vibrant Stormtrooper mural.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
After the 10-minute drive home from a night out on Park City’s Main Street, take one last look at the mountains before climbing into bed at this contemporary ski lodge. In the morning, hit the slopes bright and early with numerous access points within a few minutes. When you’re done, sink into the plush sofa next to the roaring fire or hop into the soothing hot tub.

Nestled amongst expertly landscaped trees and rugged rock gardens, Second Time embraces its iconic mountain terrain. Scenic views are captured from every room, and in the warmer months, you can swing those doors open and invite the fresh mountain breeze inside. Inside, dark wood tones, peaked ceilings, and designer furnishings offer that warm welcome home after a day on the slopes. The 2-car garage and ski storage room make it easy to deal with the elements.

After a few solid days of skiing, try some of Park City’s other outdoor activities, like tubing, dog sledding, and snowmobiling. There are plenty of equipment rental options and guided tour packages available in town and from the resorts. At night, stroll along historic Main Street and visit boutique shops, excellent restaurants, and bustling bars. In the summer, golf is a great way to take in the mountain landscape, or you could drive into Salt Lake City and enjoy the view along the way.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Feel the ocean breeze and warm Californian sun flowing throughout this airy and open smart home in Carmel-by-the-Sea. Make an afternoon snack in the chef’s kitchen, mix a cocktail at the wet bar, or just curl up by the fire, all while basking in the fresh air. Wake up early to golf at Spyglass Hill, then walk 5 minutes to Carmel Beach and cool off. Not done golfing? Pebble Beach is 6 minutes away.

A white interior gives off a European-feel, and the spiral staircase from the patio to the balcony makes it unmistakably French-inspired. Fans of organization will appreciate the corner kitchens stove and shelving units built-in to the staircase above. As well as the functionality of the island sink/breakfast bar. A simple yet elegant collection of furniture sets a refreshing, minimalistic tone.

Spend your nights dining alfresco with friends. After dinner, move the party to the balcony and sip cocktails while the sunsets. Warm yourself on cooler nights by gathering around one of 2 outdoor fireplace lounge areas, or hop into the hot tub for a refreshing soak while you do some star gazing. Inside, the kids can watch movies on the widescreen. 

Unleash your inner photographer at Carmel Beach, where the crashing of waves onto cypress-lined, white-sand shores will surely inspire a landscape picture or two. After a day on the beach, treat yourself to dinner at one of Carmel’s French restaurants, Bouchee and Grasings are 2 local favorites.

listing.listing_description:
European charm is in the details at this slopeside retreat at The Ritz-Carlton Club nestled in the shadow of Vail Mountain. You’ll see it in the village views, the turned-wood accents, and an exterior as bright yellow as a German palace—and feel it in the five-star service at the Ritz. It’s a 1-minute walk to the ski slopes and an even quicker ride on the complimentary shuttle.

After the day’s last run, follow the steam to the heated outdoor pool and hot tub at the Ritz, which villa guests are welcome to use. If it’s still sunny out, have the first après-ski drink on the furnished private terrace; if not, cozy up to the indoor fireplace instead.

Though the villa is laid out around a simple open-concept great room, luxe details elevate the space. Sink into the leather sofa or one of the armchairs in front of the fireplace, recount the day’s best runs at the welcoming round dining table for 6, or have an after-dinner coffee at the breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen.

If you’re chasing powder, board the complimentary shuttle to the slopes or make the 5-minute drive yourself to Eagle Bahn Gondola 19 at Vail Ski Resort. Beaver Creek Resort is also just 12 miles away if you’re looking for variety. For shops, restaurants, or a night out, it’s a 4-minute drive into Lionshead Village and a 2-minute drive into Vail Village.

listing.listing_description:
Sophisticated style has come to the rugged Wyoming landscape at Lodge at Shooting Star 4. This beautifully designed vacation rental sits in the shadow of the Tetons, a short drive from golf, skiing and Teton Village. Its three bedrooms are luxury havens for a ski holiday with family, an active getaway with friends or even an adventurous honeymoon in the mountains.

Watch the light move across the mountains from a private deck with a barbecue, al-fresco dining for six and a hot tub. Or unwind inside with the help of a media room and wet bar. The villa has a TV and Wi-Fi and, for your comfort and convenience, air conditioning, heating, a fireplace and laundry facilities.

Designed by renowned local architect John Carney, the lodge uses natural textures in a modern way for a look that’s both welcoming and stylish. A stone fireplace anchors the open-plan great room, and reclaimed wood cabinetry speaks to the area’s past. A double-height window floods the sitting area, dining area and fully equipped kitchen with light.

The villa has two bedrooms with king beds, including a master suite with its own gas fireplace, and one bedroom with two twin bunk beds. All three bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms. The cozy media room also has a sofa bed for larger parties or those wanting more flexible accommodations.

As part of Shooting Star, an exclusive development next to Jackson Hole Mountain Resort, the lodge has easy access to the community’s award-winning golf course and is only a short walk or shuttle ride from the resort’s ski slopes. Ride down the bike path to the entrance of Grand Teton National Park or, for a memorable day trip, drive to Yellowstone National Park. Find shopping and dining only a 3-minute drive from the villa in Teton Village.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Pull up a high-backed stool and have a cocktail at the vintage bar in this mid-century modern home in Palm Springs. Rather enjoy the moonlit desert sky, move the party out to the pool house and gather on the L-shaped sofa. In the morning, head out early for a round of golf at one of way too many PGA-caliber courses, and experience the challenge and beauty of desert golf.

Designed in 1950 by Herbert Burns, one of the founding fathers of the desert modern movement, this villa is like a living museum to fans of the style. In 2018, Modern Palms had a slight revitalization, adding new furniture, artwork, and tech features to the charming, Old Hollywood atmosphere. Outside, lush desert greenery, palm trees, and a cascading water feature create the perfect environment for reading in the shade, as well as late-night pool parties. The fully-equipped kitchen is another great spot to hang out, and if you need to slip away from the group, there’s an office space for private affairs.

If Modern Palms interior decor has inspired you, pay a visit to Palm Springs Art Museum and check out the rich history of the desert art scene. After, head to downtown Palm Springs for lunch at a local cafe, bakery, or patio restaurant. If you’re a fan of vintage clothes shopping, you’re going to love the desert cities. When you need a break from the hustle and bustle, take a stroll through Moorten Botanical Gardens to relax and unwind.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Stay in the heart of Steamboat Springs at Ambassadors Penthouse 403. This beautiful Colorado vacation rental in the Olympian complex is just minutes from shopping, dining and the town’s namesake hot springs. In the winter, a complimentary shuttle whisks guests to Steamboat Ski Resort. Book this modern, open-plan property for a laid-back vacation with family or a ski getaway with friends.

The penthouse opens to a private wraparound deck with views of the Yampa River, Howelsen Hill and Emerald Mountain. There are al-fresco sitting and dining areas, a barbecue and a hot tub big enough for six—plus a built-in heating system that keeps snow off the deck. Inside, a wet bar, wine cooler and espresso machine make entertaining a breeze, while a fireplace, flat-screen television and Wi-Fi make for cozy, quieter nights in.

The views are just as impressive through the floor-to-ceiling windows in the great room, too. The open-plan space has room for everyone to gather and enjoy each other’s company, whether on the sectional in front of the fireplace or in the soft leather chairs around the dining table. Custom cabinets and granite countertops make the fully equipped kitchen both beautiful and practical, and a breakfast bar is convenient for both morning espressos and après-ski snacks.

The three bedrooms at this luxury villa continue the spacious, modern ambience. A master suite with a king bed and an en-suite bathroom couldn’t be more welcoming after a day on the slopes or the golf course. The other two bedrooms have a queen bed and two twin beds, respectively, and share a bathroom—the perfect setup for parents and younger kids on holiday together.

Known for its challenging ski runs and lively nightlife, Steamboat Springs also has plenty of outdoor adventure, from fishing and kayaking to rafting, golf and hiking. At the end of a day out in the mountain air, soak tired muscles in the family-friendly Old Town hot springs, a 5-minute walk from the villa, or enjoy a romantic evening in the honeymoon-worthy natural pools at Strawberry Park.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Start a new tradition with family or friends at Buckhorn Townhome 53. With ski-in access and beautiful views of the Colorado landscape, this Vail Valley vacation rental is one you’ll want to return to year after year. Its three bedrooms and professionally designed interiors can welcome groups of up to eight for a holiday in style in Bachelor Gulch.

Guests of the townhome are welcome to use the shared pool and hot tubs at the nearby Ritz-Carlton Bachelor Gulch. The villa also has its own private barbecue area, plus an entertainment area with a TV, Sonos sound system and Wi-Fi. A gas fireplace keeps it cozy, and laundry facilities make it convenient.

Interiors by Ginger Barber Designs use a neutral palette and one-of-a-kind finds for a sophisticated and eclectic feel. The central open-concept great room features two sitting areas—one around the fireplace and one around the TV—along with a dining area for six and a fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar.

This luxury property has two bedrooms with king beds, including a master with a honeymoon-suite-worthy jetted tub and walk-in closet, and one bedroom with two twin bunk beds. All three bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and the same considered style as the great room: soft-toned bedding set off by antique pieces such as accent chairs and writing desks.

Buckhorn Townhome 53 enjoys ski-in access from the Ridge Rider run, and guests can walk or glide to the Roughlock run for ski-out access. For après-ski dining or shopping, make the 8-minute drive to the town of Avon or the 4-mile drive to Beaver Creek Village. If you’ll be staying during the summer, it’s also a short drive to the Beaver Creek Golf Club. And if you don’t feel like driving yourself, ask about the on-call shuttle service included in your stay at the townhome.

listing.listing_description:
Located right on Park City’s Historic Main Street, within a short stroll of boutique shops and restaurants, as well as two of Park City Resort’s most popular ski access points, this luxurious two-bedroom has it all. Perfect for an exciting honeymoon, family ski vacation, or couples retreat, both of Parkite’s private bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms, and either a king or queen sized bed. With such an incredibly convenient location, you’ll have no trouble hitting the slopes first thing in the morning, and enjoying the vibrant nightlife of Park City, Utah.

Parkite on Main Two Zero takes the modernized alpine luxury to new levels with its elegant white color scheme, designer furnishings, and contemporary accent pieces. Even the brick fireplaces have a modern twist to them, while still providing that rustic, warm feeling that only a roaring fire can. The open concept layout makes the living room a great social environment, perfect for gathering with the family and telling stories from an exciting day on the mountain.

This ultra-modern alpine home comes equipped with cable and Apple TV, an integrated sound system, Wi-Fi, and air conditioning. In the kitchen, you’ll love the stainless steel appliances, dishwasher, wine cooler, and granite island countertop that doubles as a breakfast bar. Outside, you’ll have an incredible view of the city from the relaxing hot tub and a furnished outdoor lounge. You’ll also have the use of one space in the building’s underground parking garage.

Ski access is easy in Park City, with Town Lift and Park City Mountain Resort Base both within a ten-minute walk. If you’d like to travel a little further, Deer Valley and Canyon’s Village offer even more exciting alpine action, both are located within a short drive. Just downstairs, on Historic Main Street, you’ll find plenty of cafes, restaurants, boutique shops, and local pubs to try out on your unforgettable Park City ski vacation. And, if you’re in town on a summer Sunday, check out the Park Silly Sunday Market and enjoy incredible street performers, live music, local merchants, and plenty of great food.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Doc's Holiday is an extraordinary alpine chalet at Big Sky Resort in Montana, situated just fifty feet from Alpine Meadows Run and a short walk from Moonlight Basin Clubhouse. The villa is superbly appointed for a winter or summer getaway, with an outdoor hot tub, alfresco dining, and beautifully appointed interiors with high-end features for cooking and entertainment. Two master suites, a kids' bunkroom, and a media room with extra bedding accommodate up to nine guests in total comfort. At additional cost, guests enjoy access to the amenities at Moonlight Basin Clubhouse, including a fitness center, outdoor pool, and Jack Nicklaus Signature Golf Course.

Secluded amid beautiful pine woods, the villa gazes out on sweeping valley and mountain views from its cavernous great room. The open-concept space features an ample lounge with fireplace, a table for six, and a superb kitchen with high-end stainless steel appliances, a copper sink, a wine fridge, and a lovely breakfast bar. The décor is exquisite throughout the chalet, with thick wood beams, beautiful alpine-themed artwork, and an antler chandelier above the dining table. Outside, the generous deck welcomes alfresco meals on summer evenings, while the hot tub invites you to soothing soaks under the majestic sky.

The master suite opens directly to the main deck and features a fireplace, king bed, and ensuite bathroom. The second master opens to the outdoor hot tub and also includes a king bed, fireplace, and ensuite bathroom. The kids' room enjoys easy access to the hot tub and ski path; it features a twin-over-queen bunk bed, a rollaway twin-size bed, and an ensuite bathroom. The media room—also on the lower level—has a queen sleeper sofa, TV, video game console, and ensuite bathroom.

The villa also includes a large storage room for ski and snowboard equipment. You're fifty feet from Alpine Meadows Run and a six-minute drive to the base of Big Sky Resort. Moonlight Basin Clubhouse is about a ten-minute walk from your door, and you're less than eight miles from Big Sky town.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Yeehaw! Pack those cowboy boots and Stetsons and head out to the range where wide-open spaces and a rambling ranch and bunk house sit at the end of a dusty trail. Just 25 minutes from downtown Austin, this is a mix of faux rugged, ranch chic, and 8 wild acres of Texas charm. A bunkhouse serves a mess of people as does the main ranch house where it reflects a designer’s take of hired hand and cowboy lifestyle. Leave the corporate world behind and immerse in the ranch life fantasy.

Grit and Grace Ranch sprawls with room for significant events. The heated pool, water slide, waterfall, and hot tub make swimming and soaking seem like it’s in a natural rock gorge somewhere between Amarillo and Austin after a long cattle drive. Hike the trails, bird watching, or saddle up the mountain bike to discover the rugged beauty here.

Evenings around the firepit with good bourbon and good friends, you might hear coyotes yip. It’s a time for long tales, relaxing, and noticing how the stars seem brighter. Where the urge to listen to a harmonica play a simple cowboy song mysteriously overtakes you.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
